Title: Senior Tech Reporter, NBC News Digital
RoleDescription: NBC News Digital is seeking a Senior Technology Reporter to focus on the industrys leading companies, CEOs, products and their impact on society. This is a beat about power and influence, unearthing new information about how tech leaders and platforms are shaping peoples behavior, perceptions of reality, politics, policy and the economy. The reporter will have a wide remit, focusing on revelatory reporting and the storylines with the largest import and impact: Sam Altmans decision-making at OpenAI. The impact of Mark Zuckerbergs policy changes at Meta. Scoopy stories out of Elon Musks orbit, from Tesla to DOGE and beyond.  This broad description will allow the person in this role to drive into a core area of expertise while also flexing into other major storylines of the day. The ideal candidate will have experience with deep source-building and enterprise reporting on one or several tech beats, with a history of scoops and exclusives. We are looking for someone who is excited to activate on major breaking news, adding context, analysis and fresh information. Success in this role means publishing revelatory, exclusive information; rich and deep enterprise reporting; and sharp and engaging analysis. Your journalism should be insightful and useful to our audience and distinct from the scores of other reporters on the tech beat today. The reporter has to be an impeccable and engaging writer who can capture the zeitgeist and be a thought leader in their space. Their source base must also be impeccable, with a broad range of well-placed and well-informed sources who will illustrate major storylines.  This reporter will work closely with teams across Digital, with the NBC News business and economy unit and with the Washington DC Bureau. The reporter will be part of the NBC News Digital team, with an immediate focus on writing for NBCNews.com and leading a new, weekly newsletter. Theyll share their reporting with the broader network and then appear on air if requested. This position can be based full-time in San Francisco, Washington DC or New York and is designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of 3 days per week.This position is represented by the NewsGuild - CWA. Key Responsibilities Publishing exclusive and revelatory information at a regular cadence Desire to write about the industrys leading companies, CEOs and products, with an ability to hit the zeitgeist  Focus on major storylines of national interest and deliver scoops and detailed well-written enterprise and analysis pieces. Having a deep, robust, accurate and plugged-in source base An ability to write with flair and voice, while not veering into opinion At least 8 years reporting on the technology industry or a related beat  Impeccable journalistic standards and ethics and a high bar for sourcing  Ability to produce fresh information for a 1x weekly newsletter Ability to jump between breaking news, exclusives and deeper takes  Comfortable discussing reporting on NBC platforms when needed Desired Characteristics Desire to work closely across teams to get the best story Understands audience engagement and how to make stories stand out online Additional Requirements:Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week.This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Title: Supervisor, Health Services
RoleDescription: As a Health Services Supervisor at Universal Studios Hollywood, you will be an integral part of the team dedicated to ensuring the health and safety of our guests, team members and vendor partners.  Your role, alongside the other team supervisor and manager, is to lead our team of nurses, emergency medical technicians, and paramedics. They are responsible for delivering exceptional guest service through compassionate and prompt first aid care to our guests, as well as preventive and post-injury occupational health care to our team members.  You will also be involved in supporting occupational health initiatives and collaborating with various departments to maintain a safe work environment and drive continuous process improvement for delivery of health services to the guests and Team Members at Universal Studios Hollywood. Conduct regular reviews of records for accuracy, identify gaps, and develop and implement processes for continuous improvement.Training and Development: Assist in developing and delivering training programs for team members to enhance their skills and knowledge in health services.Policy & Procedure Development: Assist with developing, implementing, and reviewing protocols, SOPs, and health policies to ensure regulatory compliance and operational efficiency. Evaluate and recommend tools and technologies that enhance service delivery.Guest and Team Member Support: Address and resolve health-related or operational concerns from guests and team members, providing excellent internal and external guest service and support.Safety and Compliance: Ensure all health services' operations comply with safety standards and regulations. Participate in the safety committee.Budget Management: Support the creation and management of labor and non-labor budgets for the health services department.
